metadata.text1:
Get IV access & if possible perform sepsis screen

Sepsis screen: FBC, CRP, Blood culture +/- Lumbar Puncture

(CRP is C-reactive protein a marker of infection available in some labs)
metadata.text2:
Start antibiotics according to local guidelines. If no guidelines give 
- Penicillin 50,000 iu/kg 12 hrly IV/IM and 
- Gentamicin 3 or 5 mg/kg/dose 24hrly IV/IM (LBW or Term)  

Length of antibiotics: at least 5 days, 7-10 days if symptomatic

Change frequency of Penicillin to 6 hrly if > 7days age
metadata.text3:
Thermoregulation: aim for temperature between 36.5 - 37.5

If baby has fever (T = 38.5) remove from warmer and unwrap 

Provide respiratory support as needed

Check blood glucose and provide feeding support as needed

- Consider 10ml/kg fluid bolus if shocked 
- Consider 2.5mls/kg 10% dextrose if BS< 2.6
